Wait, the game is "as-of-yet incomplete"? Anyway that makes no sense: one can only guess about the "unrealized potential" of this game because SQUAD hasn't published a roadmap. There's also plenty of dev confirmations about features that will be included or not included to make judgements about the wasted potential in this game.

I have a sneaky feeling that something not many people have thought of is on the horizon for .25

Whilst people think them buying up Porkjet's Spaceplane means an atmosphere update is on the way, i think that because they also announced crew transfer is incoming, that might lend it in another direction...

...spacestation update. a) make it into space easier with Porkjet's parts make transferring to stations easier without EVA... and then c) adding contracts for spacestations and spacestation science goals.

Just a guess, but one that seems to fit the facts more than some other guesses out there.

Thing is, early access games, its the early access players (read: us) who give the majority of feedback. they look to our praise and our complaints to see where they need to improve, or keep things the same. they aren't required to listen, heavens no, but they created a forum with various boards(namely the "support & bugs" and the "suggestions & development") to help them receive that feedback.

Red Iron Crown sums up quite nicely why your argument here is wrong. Also, as an early-access purchaser I most certainly have a vested interest in the direction the game takes; I bought a product on future promises. Now, while that may not really entitle me to anything in particular, it does mean I have every right to complain about the future of said product when that future looks bleak from where I stand.

Can we please get this thread back on track? Thanks, everyone.

Regarding the Mk1 parts, well there's not a lot to them really. It's not a size as such, just an alternate name for a few 1.25 m parts, and because it's the 1.25 m size there's not a need for many parts. We have two cockpits - I think the old "Mk 2 cockpit" should be renamed since it's actually Mk1/1.25 m size - a jet fuel tank and a structural fuselage. An improved mass fractions on the jet fuel tank and a half-length version would be nice, ditto a half-length structural fuselage, but what else is there really to add? Passenger fuselage maybe, like a skinny version of the hitchhiker, that's about it.
